## 판결문 요약

768 F.2d 722
    Frank BODZIN, Plaintiff-Appellant,v.CITY OF DALLAS, Alonzo Burgin, Steven Padgett, and SkaggsCompanies, Inc., Defendants-Appellees.
    No. 84-1695.
    
      Summary Calendar.
      United States Court of Appeals,Fifth Circuit.
      Aug. 19, 1985.
      Douglas R. Larson, Dallas, Tex., for plaintiff-appellant.
      Joseph G. Werner, 1st Asst. City Atty., Sam A. Lindsay, Rhonda F. Hunter, Asst. City Attys., Dallas, Tex., for City of Dallas, A. Burgin & S. Padgett.
      Strasburger & Price, W. Neil Rambin, Michael Jung, Dallas, Tex., for Skaggs Companies/American Stores, Inc.
      Appeal from the United States District Court for the Northern District of Texas.
      Before CLARK, Chief Judge, WILLIAMS and HIGGINBOTHAM, Circuit Judges.
      PATRICK E. HIGGINBOTHAM, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      Frank Bodzin appeals the district court's dismissal by directed verdict, judgment upon verdict, and judgment notwithstanding verdict of his claims against two Dallas police officers, the City of Dallas, and Skaggs Companies, Inc. arising from an assertedly illegal arrest for trespass.  Persuaded that even under Bodzin's version of the evidence, the officers had probable cause to arrest, we affirm.
